top_comment.text:
Where's the dark undertone? Puppy cat was suppose to be a outlaw from 
Space, betrayed by his love and "cursed" to be a dog-cat, fighting 
monsters(possibly once friends, or enemies disguised as friends) while we 
discover his dark past hidden behind cute designs, hiding the dark truth.
-Now it's all just cute designs.﻿
top_comment.author: dasdew2

comments.text:
If you're going for a lighthearted cute comedy like this, ultimately plot 
will have to be discarded. Keeping things timeless allows for more freedom 
regarding episode ideas.   Think  of the Powerpuff girls, no plot, just 
cute/quirky self contained mini stories.
This isn't bad at all,  the mix of dark and cute they were going for in the 
pilot would've been incredible, but it's also very, very risky and requires 
surgical precision when it comes to writing and story progression.  

tl;dr  Sticking to the elements in the pilot would've been phenomenal and 
unique, but the safe path isn't bad by any means.  I like this too.
comments.author: Mathemagics

comments.text: +M Ok It's not about needing it, it's just what was expected.
comments.author: dasdew2

comments.text:
+dasdew2 It doesn't need to have "dark undertones," to be good? I mean 
we're already seeing characters issues being fleshed out with the first few 
episodes. (Bee's working/adult life issues, Deckard's issues with Bee's 
issues, as well as possible personal problems, Cardamon's mom. So I doubt 
it's going to drop there? Just give it some time, you can even see the art 
direction changed some from the pilot. Things change, you see that in all 
shows. From beginning to end they develop a lot. Idk what you're expecting.
comments.author: M Ok

comments.text: +raven drake Yeah, I was worried that cat bug would become the main focus.
comments.author: dasdew2

comments.text:

comments.author: DrStrikeZero

comments.text:
+LittleMissSunshine You're an illustrator? Me too! :D *highfive* Anyways, 
yeah. I've just resolved to simply seeing where things go and remain

comments.author: Brie Nelson

comments.text:
Yea, I think the proportions are off, but Im an illustrator so I notice it 
too. I know style varies and thats fine. I miss what the pilot was about, 
I'm also trying to stay patient and wait. I hope it gets better :(
comments.author: LittleMissSunshine

comments.text:
+LittleMissSunshine O_O Wow, that's very defensive. I don't see how the new 
style relates to the plot, but okay. I understand the charm of the new and 
old style, but I can understand why she feels the proportions are off. I 
know a lot of people don't like how "fat" Bee is, but it doesn't really 
bother me at all. 
But what made me and almost everyone fall in love with the pilot was the 
plot. It was fun, cute, and lighthearted. But it also had hints towards 
darker subject matter and how the plot would progress. I understand it's 
still early on in the series and I'm trying to remain patient, but it still 
misses that cute mixed with dark charm.
comments.author: Brie Nelson

comments.text:
+Brie Nelson I wrote Nat about the re-design and her response wasn't great. 
And I quote "let’s just get something out there right away, the proportions 
in the pilot are BAD. they have no character and are generic. it blows my 
mind that people think they’re “better” (whatever that means). i made the 
changes because we were able to hire people to draw the way i wanted to. if 
by “depth as a character” you mean really bad design and shitty in 
betweens, then yeah in the pilot she was super deep. the direction of the 
story is the same, i definitely don’t understand why you’d think 
otherwise." I was quite taken aback. I didn't attack her in anyway, I was 
jsut curious as to what happened. To be fair, I think a lot of people have 
been asking her about the re-design so I think she's getting frustrated. I 
miss the pilot.
comments.author: LittleMissSunshine

comments.text:
+jesninetyeight
Yeah, but I still wish there were more fight scenes like in the pilot. 
However this is the shows start so I bet it will more action-y over time. I 
really hope they bring back Bee's spacesuit. I liked how it matched the 
other-worldly atmosphere.

top_comment.author: Amer Djuliman

comments.text:
+Amer Djuliman  I agree. While I still enjoy the series, I feel as though 
it didn't really retain that quirky charm it had in the pilot. I also wish 
Bee's personality hadn't done a complete 180 and her design hadn't either.
comments.author: Emily Shin

comments.text:
+Hearth Stoned I just really liked the pilot, and everything about it. It 
had humor, incredible style, perfect animation, really lovable characters 
and great story. It really pulled you right into the story, and in short, 
it felt good to watch. To me it felt like something really good that only 
comes around occasionally, but most of all, it had effort. We can all 
respect that. It just felt wrong to not admire something so good people 
created with 0$ budget. But then, with nearly a million dollar of fan 
donations, they twisted everything we hoped for into...this. WHAT IS THIS!? 
Get sober Hangover, you can still make things right! Everybody expects that 
in season 2 (and how can you call 4 episodes a season like seriously) you 
make something really good like YOU KNOW YOU CAN!!
comments.author: Amer Djuliman

comments.text:
+Amer Djuliman I agree so much, they got a $800 000 budget from their 
kickstarter, and we end up getting something way different. I feel like the 
pilot was just to pull us in so they could have the money they needed to 
animate what it is now. This is wrong on so many levels.
comments.author: Hearth Stoned

comments.text: +Amer Djuliman true dat *+1*
comments.author: REALwoombath

comments.text: +FluffyWooden Thank you.
comments.author: Amer Djuliman

comments.text: +Amer Djuliman Agree with this guy
comments.author: FluffyWooden

comments.text:
Well scooze me princess for wanting what I was promised! The pilot 
introduced a bit dark story about a cursed outlaw who we can only assume is 
one of the two main protagonists. In her first mission, Bee received a cool 
suit and a sword, and they fought a japanese-like monster, super creepy by 
the way, and they finished it off with an energy beam. HOW COOL IS THAT!? 
But the actual series? Bee suddenly gained a 100 pounds, they switched the 
style completely, it's not even fun anymore, the main problem is not 
killing monsters but looking cute, and the villains are not even cool, 
original creatures but...giant cats? WTF!? What happened!? This is not what 
we wanted! Give us what you promised!
comments.author: Amer Djuliman

comments.author: Яad Aшaу

comments.text:
Because the voice change was way different than it had been in previous 
episodes. Before it was a squeaky, high pitched voice, and then all of a 
sudden, it's a sassy voice. It surprised the hell out of me. But when I 
wrote the comment, I didn't know why Temp Bot's voice kept changing, and so 
it aggravated me, especially when they made such a huge change from a 
squeaky child type voice to a full grown woman voice. Btw, what the hell 
does being racist have anything to do with being a weeaboo?

top_comment.text:
Mid season already? It hasn't even been like 5 episodes. You know when you 
announced you were making a series I thought you were going to air it every 
week, or at least every 2 weeks, but you make us wait so long for each 
episode and now it's already halfway through? Mind you we technically only 
saw 2 episodes since 2 episodes is only 1 story. But seriously it's already 
mid season? You can't make it until 12 episodes or something like they 
usually do with cartoons? 


I know me complaining here isn't going to change anything but just let me 
vent it here because I really really like Bee and Puppycat.﻿
top_comment.author: piplupcola

comments.text:
I just have to say how great that Bee and Puppycat short was. Even with two

comments.author: TheMedievalHamster

comments.text:
+Source90000 Relax bro, there's no reason to start bitching about how much 
your butt hurts, we're all friends here.
comments.author: 593swheeler

comments.text:
+HipsterSheep Agreed. I don't think anyone here is complaining, but people 
did back the kickstarter and it raised around 872,133$. If people are going 
to give that kind of money to you to make something, make sure you deliver 
on the promise that you made. I personally loved the pilot of Bee/puppycat, 
but once I saw the new design, well that was the end of it. Not everyone is 
going to agree and thats fine, I still support Nat and CH for the hard work 
they've put in. I just wish Nat wasn't so defensive and angry when people 
ask her about the new re-design. People are curious, no need to get 
defensive, these are the people that are helping you grow your dream, at 
least be courteous to them. Anyways, sorry for the long reply haha.
comments.author: LittleMissSunshine

comments.author: 593swheeler

comments.text:
If you really like bee and puppycat, look into the animation process. The 
amount of work and budgeting it takes is enormous. Also don't bite the hand 
that feeds you, its extremely rude to say these things when its free 
entertainment that takes approximately 700 images a minute to create.
comments.author: Adam West

comments.text:
+HipsterSheep You also have to look at the writing and animation quality 
though. A lot of money goes into hiring additional animators and writers.

Still, while that is true, I also think that they should have been able to 
make twice the episodes they said they could. While the animation is 
amazing, it's not very hard to capture, and it's not like it's incredibly 
high definition. The art style is unique and great, but it doesn't take the 
budget that they're anticipating. The writing is also really good, but 
there's only so much a writer can charge for good writing. I think that 
they overestimated the cost per episode, and may or may not release extra 
episodes at the end of the season to compensate.
comments.author: 593swheeler

comments.text:
+AmbiPieandDashachu (a.k.a. E.S. Gryph-Nyx~) Oh, I'm tired of these crap 
excuses. The Reward has promised 12 7-minute episodes with around $100,000. 
There is a difference between the budgets of cartoons that have 30 
30-minute episodes, and the budget of a cartoon that has 9 5-minute 
episodes.
comments.author: HipsterSheep

comments.text:
+Jon Lester that isn't big budget, millions goes into AT, SU, a lot goes

comments.text: +Indigo199517 wait she has an eating disorder?
comments.author: Full Moon Lover

comments.text:
+Full Moon Lover
Temp Bot: "Welcome Puppycat! You look different..."

It's possible that Puppycat is the Space Outlaw (considering his reflection 
thing in the pilot episode shows as much), and he was transformed into some 
weird *thing* that nobody except Bee apparently wants, because cat/dogs are 
weird. Bee suddenly cry's a crystal tear-drop.... something is special 
about her, but we do know that she's weird, has a eating disorder, and is 
incredibly lonely. It's possible that, like you said, the Space Princess' 
father dealt with the Outlaw without his daughter knowing about it, and now 
she's a sobbing wreck... or perhaps she's eccentric enough that she forgot 
about the meet-up time xD

Either way, Bee and [Puppycat] somehow got reunited again, but in different 
circumstances while still retaining their personality's. They stick 
together for some inexplicable reason, and I'm curious to know if this is 
the "bond" they shared before or if it's something else.

Anyways, time will tell us and hopefully we'll get some answers before the 
series is finished :-)
comments.author: Indigo199517

is the princess

captions.text: Are you ready for some temp work?
We just need you to be a TV for a few hours
WHEN DOES HE GET AN OUTFIT?!
Cafe? I worked at a cat cafe before...
PuppyCat, why is there so much fabric in the crotch?
Sooooo cute. Would you like a pastry?
Wait...do...I GET TO BE A CAT?!?
Usually we have a bunch of different pets to fawn over,
but you're the only one today!
Do you have everything you need?
"We now return to the Pretty Patrick marathon! (howls)"
"Oh. They forgot to leave out the tomatoes."
You're not cute enough to be a pet here!!
Shhh, PuppyCat, I'm trying to listen to Patrick.
"...apple pie, pear pie? Raspberry pie, blackberry pie..."
That's okay. It's no big deal.
Looks like we're gonna have to clean you up.
AAAH WAIT! So who's gonna lick me?
We don't clean with tongues here.
We're gonna dump you in a bath!

(Bee) OH NO NO OH NO NO NO NO
(Cats) YEA YEA OH YEA YEA YEA
AAAAHHH THERE YOU ARE AAAAHHH C'MERE
What? You didn't see any of it??
I'm sorry, I was too busy eating to pay attention to you.
I'm the worst pet owner ever.

Ewww, gross
Oh, god, we need baths.
Awwww, we just missed the new episode!
"Dear Bee, I taped that show you wanted to watch,"
(reading) "I don't know why you'd want to watch a show
where a guy just eats a pile of mashed potatoes,
but I'm not one to judge."

title: Midseason Finale "Cats" - Bee and PuppyCat - Ep. 4 (Cartoon Hangover)
